content: <@755612893046636585> fyi just in case it is useful - you can fetch a trin node’s enr over the “discv5_nodeInfo” jsonrpc endpoint rather than scraping logs

author: pipermerriam
content: Base protocol should already be capable to keeping enr updated on both sides. The handshake to establish the encrypted channel ensures that one side gets an updated ENR and that the other side knows whether they need to request an updated record as informed by knowing sequence numbers.

author: pipermerriam
content: So by the time that the utp protocol messages start flowing there's an assurance that at least one side has a fully updated ENR and that the other can pull an updated ENR if they do choose
